title.narrative: Southeast Gobi Urban and Border Town Development Project —Additional Financing

description.narrative: The additional financing and the administration of the TA grant will scale up and extend the socioeconomic benefits of the project by improving the quality and reliability of wastewater management services in two aimag centers from the current project, and by extending service improvements to two additional prominent and fast-growing aimag centers. The additional financing will also continue to strengthen through the TA, the wastewater management capabilities of aimag public utility service organizations (PUSOs) in both the current and additional project aimag centers.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Construction and Urban Development
Ministry of Construction and Urban Development

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved urban governance and expanded access to sustainable infrastructure and services in urban places in Southeast Gobi

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

Overall project By September 2015 a. New water, sewerage, SWM, and heating use in planned (non-ger) areas increased to 95 % in soums and to 100 % in 4 project aimag centers by 2016 (2010 baseline: soums 0%, 4 aimags 95%)

description.narrative: Improved urban governance and expanded access to sustainable infrastructure and services in urban places in Southeast Gobi

title.narrative: By June 2020 b. At least 9,000 m3/day of fully treated wastewater discharged in 4 aimags (2015 baseline: 0 m3/day)

description.narrative: Improved urban governance and expanded access to sustainable infrastructure and services in urban places in Southeast Gobi

title.narrative: c. At least 3 of 4 PUSOs with annual revenues greater than expenses (2014 baseline: 1)

description.narrative: Improved urban governance and expanded access to sustainable infrastructure and services in urban places in Southeast Gobi

title.narrative: d. At least 90% of new infrastructure projects started in 2016–2020 follow approved urban master plans in soums and aimag centers (2014 baseline: not applicable)

description.narrative: Improved urban governance and expanded access to sustainable infrastructure and services in urban places in Southeast Gobi
